textList.text: Even though the Engi were not made for close combat, the Federation owes them a lot in terms of military research. The Engi station at the beacon offers a breakthrough combat augment for free.
A friendly Engi research station contacts you: "Combat testing required. Transferring equipment."
A tiny Engi scientific vessel, that you mistook for a drone at first, contacts you: "Collected military equipment. Model unsuitable. Ejecting."

A small Engi research vessel is trying to fend off a Mantis ship. You move in to engage, but after a quick scan of your ship the Mantis ship retreats. The Engi offer you a drone schematic as thanks for your timely arrival.
You encounter a swarm of advanced Engi surveying drones flying through space completely autonomously. One of the drones decides to leave the swarm and starts to orbit your ship instead.
Seeing that you're representing Federation, a local Engi research station offers one of its drones built for combat for free.
An Engi vessel hails you. "Identity: Federation? Outlier probability. Implies... revival. Implies... hope. Assistance suggested." They offer some supplies.
You cross paths with an Engi cargo vessel hurrying home before the Mantis fleets attempt to take over this sector. They're happy to offload some of their cargo to get home faster.
You make contact with an isolated Engi science station who are staying put despite the likelihood of Mantis invasion. They suggest you trial some experimental technology.
This was the site of a recent battle. Either a show of Mantis force, or the Engi here weren't disposed to go peacefully. You pick through the pieces.

event.name: ENGI_TRADER
event.text: There are a number of merchant ships passing through the area despite the threat of Mantis invasion. No doubt interested in buying the efficient technology of the Engi. One of the trading ships makes an offer.

event.name: ENGI_FLEET_DELAY
event.text: You notice an Engi colony hiding on the other side of a nearby moon. It turns out they're excavating an equipment cache from the Federation-Mantis War, and they suggest it might be used to lure the pursuing Rebel fleet.
You transfer down some missile warheads and the Engi rig them to blow before setting a distress signal to attract the fleet's attention.
You have the Engi complete their excavations and bring the supplies on-board.

changelog.entry: Removed free scrap rewards in DISTRESS_ENGI_REACTOR event

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REACTOR
event.text: You arrive at a smoldering Engi research station, its distress call unanswered - attacked by pirates or Mantis most likely. There may be someone left alive, or else something of value left on board.
You send an away team to investigate, but there's nothing save for the acidic stench of burnt Engi parts. This place is dead.
Your away team reports a wounded Engi and a functioning drone schematic. Then someone yells. The station reactor is overloading and they're running out of time!

One of your crew valiantly grabs the Engi and throws it into the airlock right before the reactor blows and the automatic blast doors slam shut. You have no choice but to mourn their sacrifice and move on.

removeCrew.text: The brave crewmember's clone strides from the Clone Bay, rather full of themself after such a heroic act.

event.text: The Engi who was saved offers to join your crew.
Your crew return safely to the airlock with the injured Engi and you put some distance on the station before it blows. The Engi, impressed by your crew, volunteers to join you.
Your away team heads home with the goods, but as they transfer back to the ship a small explosion blows the airlock and one of the crew is sucked out into space!

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.

event.text: The Engi don't feel things the same way other species do. They'd want the tech to be saved. Your crew return safely to the airlock with the drone control and you put some distance on the station before it blows.
It's a tough order, but your crew's lives are the priority. They drop everything and return to the ship unharmed. You put some distance on the station before it blows.
The place looks in bad state, probably nothing of use there. Time to move on.

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REACTOR_SCAN
event.text: Scans reveal the station's reactor is overloading! Not only that, but an injured Engi and a functioning drone schematic are still on board! There's not time for both...

Your away team heads straight for the Engi and returns with time to spare. You put some distance on the station before it blows and the Engi is so impressed by your crew that they volunteer to join you!

The Engi don't feel things the same way other species do. They'd want the tech to be saved. Your away team heads straight for the goods and returns with time to spare. You put some distance on the station before it blows.

event.name: CONFUSED_MANTIS
event.text: As soon as you jump into the system, you receive a hail from a nearby civilian Engi vessel. Their captain appears on your screen: "Strange bug. Can you assist in debugging?"
"Found malfunctioning Mantis. Believes it is human. Will receive input only from human. Danger Evaluation: Extremely High. Provide assistance."

choice.text: Send a shuttle with an away team to help.

event.text: After an hour of convincing, the Mantis finally calms down and introduces himself as Robert Smith. He explains he's from a nearby human colony and would appreciate being returned there.
The cornered and frightened Mantis attacks as soon as you approach. One of your crew is eviscerated before the rest are able to stop him. The Engi apologize for your loss.

removeCrew.text: Your crew's clone is waiting when you return to the ship.

event.text: The cornered and frightened Mantis attacks as soon as you approach. You're able to subdue him and leave him at a Mantis colony in a neighboring system. They don't seem pleased or grateful at his return.

choice.text: Leave them, a cornered Mantis is too dangerous.
(Human Crew) Send your human crewmember to communicate with the Mantis.

event.text: The Mantis is grateful to see 'another human', and introduces himself as Robert Smith. He explains he's from a nearby human colony and would appreciate being returned there.

choice.text: (Mantis Crew) Send your Mantis crewmember to communicate with the Mantis.

event.text: The Mantis is terrified at the sight of your crewmember. He immediately attacks his Engi rescuers, and your crewmember is forced to kill him. The Engi are grateful for your help and offer a small reward.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Use your Mind control System to calm him down.

event.text: The Mantis calms down and communicates thanks to the Engi and yourself for helping. He requests to be dropped off at a nearby planet, at the human colony where he was raised. They are grateful for his return and offer a reward.

choice.text: Explain that you can't do any programming and leave.

event.name: CONFUSED_MANTIS_HOME
event.text: The colony is a mining operation that specializes in FTL fuel. Robert's family, the head engineers, are excited to see him, and are very grateful for his return. Apparently he ran away to 'join the Federation' like his older brother, but was never accepted onto a ship.

choice.text: Offer him a position on your ship.

event.text: He graciously accepts, having always wanted to serve in the Federation.

choice.text: Ask if they can take a look at your engines.

event.text: They are happy to take a look, and are able to offer some suggestions for improvements.

changelog.entry: Added Engi station requires workers event

event.name: ENGI_STATION_REQUIRES_WORKERS
event.text: You jump in to find a big industrial Engi station broadcasting a message. "Assistance required. Insufficient workforce. Station security compromised." You could send a part of your crew to find out if they need any help.

choice.text: Send one crewmember to the station.

event.text: Your crewmember leaves in a small one-man shuttle for the Engi station. The remaining crew is looking forward to seeing them again.

removeCrew.text: As your crewman is still alive and helping on the Engi station, it would be against Federation regulation to create a clone to continue with you on your journey.

event.text: After hours of wait, an Engi worker arrives to your ship and requests a permission to work for the Federation. "Subordinate left. Substitution arrived." It seems that your former crewmember could not return.

You wait for your crewmember to return. After several hours you receive a message. "I am staying here. The pay is better, social benefits, and stable oxygen production." The Engi station compensates your loss with resources.

event.name: ENGI_SYSTEM_UPGRADE
event.text: A giant Engi ship construction yard is located at the beacon. Learning that you're Federation, the Engi offers you to upgrade a system of your choice for free.
The necessary modifications to shield system are installed, allowing for more protective layers.
The necessary modifications to engine system are installed, allowing for faster FTL charge speed.
The necessary modifications to medical system are installed, allowing for faster healing.
The necessary modifications to cloning system are installed, speeding up internal processes.
The necessary modifications to life support system are installed, your crew is very grateful.
The necessary modifications to teleporter are installed, minimizing downtime.
The necessary modifications to cloaking system are installed, your enemies did not see that coming.
The necessary modifications to artillery system are installed, speeding up charge time.
The necessary modifications to hacking system are installed, increasing duration.
The necessary modifications to mind control system are installed, increasing efficiency.
The necessary modifications to weapon system are installed, allowing to expand your arsenal.
The necessary modifications to drone control system are installed, allowing to expand your drone fleet.

choice.text: Decline. We don't need free upgrades.

event.name: ENGI_MCCLONEY
event.text: An intruder teleports on deck. You cannot believe your eyes: it's Doctor McCloney, a famous human researcher and inventor of a clonebay! "Spare me from your most honorable reception. This ship has to change course immediately, I am late for scientific conference in an Engi world nearby."

choice.text: Give a lift to Doctor McCloney.

event.text: "Of course you will make sure that I attend the meeting as soon as possible. But did you know that I am not Doctor McCloney himself, just one of his countless clones? I am the only person in the Federation who is legally allowed to have clones."

event.name: ENGI_MCCLONEY_QUEST
event.text: Doctor McCloney leaves the cabin reserved for VIP, safe from fire hazards and equipped with autonomous oxygen generator. "A bit late, but I won't blame you for the delay." The researcher leaves the ship, and you have time to explore what Engi have to offer.

There are all kinds of medical equipment in the Engi system. The Engi doctors are operating on all kinds of patients: saving burnt Mantis and dried Slugs, transplanting organs and removing tumors with their superior knowledge and technology.
One of the Engi doctors learns that you are one of the last remnants of Federation force and offers to help you. "Medical facilities. Clonebay recommended."
For a small amount of scrap, the Engi workers agree to install a medical system on your ship. The doctors from the hospital provide medications and observe the installation process.

The Engi doctors and laborers flood your ship, bringing materials, and installing a cloning system in one of empty rooms. The crew transfers their DNA data. They are not looking forward to getting cloned, but do not question your orders.
An unorthodox choice. The crew installs a med-bot delivery system in one of your weapon slots and loads it up with ammunition.
The Engi doctor brings one of their latest inventions. He tries to explain you how it works, but you struggle to understand anything but a few words: "Nano-bots" and "Micro-cloning."
One of the Engi doctors learns that you are one of the last remnants of Federation force and offers to help you. "Medical facilities. System interchange."

The Engi from the station help you with installation. They clear the DNA data and remove your cloning system and install a new medbay in its place. Leaving the system, you make sure not to cross paths with Doctor McCloney again.

One of the Engi doctors learns that you are one of the last remnants of Federation force and offers to help you. "Crew immortality. Mission success probability increase: 0.174%."

The medbay is uninstalled, and Engi laborers bring a cloning system as a replacement. The crew transfers their DNA data. They are not looking forward to getting cloned, but do not question your orders.

event.name: ENGI_ENTERTAINMENT
event.text: Even though each "individual" Engi is made up of trillions of nano-machines, their culture still revolves around traditional social interactions. A nearby station seems to be constructed for entertainment of passing Engi travellers.

You pay a small fee and make your way into the station. Most of the Engi are just resting at the bar, and "talking" using emoticons, fragmentary phrases and, mostly, numbers. The main event seems to be going on in the conference hall. It should be worth visiting.

choice.text: (Slug) Explain that you absolutely have to get in for free.

event.text: The bouncers reluctantly agree and let your crew into the station.Most of the Engi are just resting at the bar, and "talking" using emoticons, fragmentary phrases and, mostly, numbers. The main event seems to be going on in the conference hall, largest room on the station. It should be worth visiting.

choice.text: There is no time for entertainment.

event.name: ENGI_ENTERTAINMENT_STAGE
event.text: You enter the hall, and it looks like you interrupted some sort of a stand up show. The Engi comedian, performing on a makeshift stage, tries really hard at making fun of your crew, but his attempts fall short.
You have no idea how to entertain the Engi and none of your jokes reach the audience. In the end, you say: "Protocol 8.06". Everyone cringes. You leave the station very embarrassed.

choice.text: (Mantis) Send your crewmember to the stage to perform next.

event.text: As the Mantis moves towards the stage, the previous comedian drops the mic and runs away in fear. The audience, visibly afraid, makes a line to the exit. The Mantis makes a great performance... to an empty hall. After some time, security kicks you out.

choice.text: (Rockman) Send your crewmember to the stage to perform next.

event.text: The Rockman goes up on stage and makes a silly face. Then another one. It seems that the entire comedy culture of Rock people is based on body language. No one in the hall even looks at the stage. You leave the station with empty hands.

choice.text: (Slug) Send your crewmember to the stage to perform next.

event.text: With telepathic abilities, Slugs are good at reading the room. Your crewmember is able to entertain the Engi audience. One of the newfound fans wants to join your crew.

choice.text: (Pavonian) Send your crewmember to the stage to perform next.

event.text: You were sceptical at sending the Pavonian at first, but they make an amazing performance, somehow managing to entertain even the nerdiest of Engi. One of those offers to join your crew.

changelog.entry: Added Green Planet event to Engi sector

event.name: ENGI_GREEN_PLANET
event.text: You arrive at a green planet with great plains and rolling waterfalls. It would be of little interest to the Engi nearby.

choice.text: Send the shuttle to the planet.

event.text: Your team landed in a shuttle and spread out to explore the planet. After a few minutes, a cloud of dust appeared on the horizon. Using optic magnifiers, you could make out a herd of giant long-legged alien beasts.

As soon as the animals saw a shuttle made of metallic parts, they charged. The herd moved so fast, that your team was too late to react and the animals managed to eat large parts of shuttle's hull before being driven away. You would need to use all spare scrap to repair the transport.

choice.text: The exploration team did not find anything useful on the planet and returned with empty hands, understanding why Engi had so little interest in settling there.

event.text: As soon as the animals saw an Engi, they charged. The herd moved so fast, your team did not have enough time to react. The animals ate the Engi and galloped away, uninterested in attacking anyone else.

removeCrew.text: You are sure that the eaten crewmember is already being cloned back on the ship.

event.text: The exploration team did not find anything useful on the planet and returned with empty hands, understanding why Engi had so little interest in settling there.

Even though it seemed that the planet would be full of life after initial scans, after landing the team found nothing but a devastated desert. The winds on the planet are so strong, that organic life is eroded away.

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Scan the landing site thoroughly.

event.text: Scanning indicated that there is an abnormal amount of rare metals deep within the soil near the landing site. After hours of drilling, your team excavates a cache left by someone years ago. Probably, pirates.

It turns out, that the planet is not barren after all. The atmosphere is full of microscopic organisms, that fly very fast, causing the winds. Using the nets, your team captures some of the creatures who are revealed to have high concentration of rare metals in their bodies.

choice.text: (Slug) A crewmember senses something in the air.

event.text: It turns out, that the planet is not barren after all. The atmosphere is full of microscopic organisms, that fly very fast, causing the winds. Using the nets, your team captures some of the creatures who are revealed to have high concentration of rare metals in their bodies.

After landing on the planet, your team learns that it is inhabited by flying reptiles of enormous size. Scanning the surface shows that the lair nearby contains useful materials including rare metals.

Your team approaches the reptile's lair. It is a cave in a giant mountain, far above the surface. Entering the cave using powered exoskeletons will not be difficult, but someone must distract the reptile.

choice.text: Order one of your crewmembers to distract the reptile.

event.text: A volunteer makes a distraction, while the rest of the team sneaks into the cave. The reptile eats the sacrificed crewmember alive and returns back to the lair. Your team grabs whatever they can, and gets safely to the shuttle, almost detected by an animal.

removeCrew.text: The clone of the lost crewmember is ready on the ship, making a note to themselves to never volunteer to distract giant monsters ever again.

event.text: The Aquarian successfully sneaks into the cave using their cloak. Your crewmember picks up as much equipment as they can carry, choosing what they deem most valuable: everything shiny and of blue color.

Your crewmember boldly approaches the reptile and attempts to become acquainted with them. To everyone's surprise, they quickly become friends. A reptile gladly donates one of its favorite "toys" for their "little sibling".

choice.text: (Anti-Personnel Drone) Use a drone as a distraction.

event.text: The drone makes an excellent distraction, letting your team into the dangerous cave without losses. The team does not have much time, so they grab whatever they see first, what will be used as scrap later.

choice.text: (Boarding Drone) Use a drone as a distraction.

event.text: The drone makes an excellent distraction, letting your team into the dangerous cave without losses. The team does not have much time, so they grab whatever they see first, what will be used as scrap later.

choice.text: (Ion Intruder) Use a drone as a distraction.

event.text: The Ion Intruder distracts the reptile successfully, and even manages to stun it when devoured. Your team has enough time to enter the cave, pick the most valuable equipment there, and leave safely.
